title: Sarvepalli MLA encourages students to participate in social service
content: Around 70 students from Nellore, Prakasam and Chittoor districts participate in the district-level Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament 2025 at Vikrama Simhapuri University

title: Tamil Nadu government rejects charges of illegal shifting of minerals out of the State and over-mining in quarries
content: Vehicles are being checked thoroughly at the checkpoints on the inter-State borders and e-transit pass and e-grant of minor minerals will be introduced in phases, says Duraimurugan

title: Orthodox Church members move court against installation of Jacobite Catholicos
content: Three members file suit the Kottayam munsiff court, seeking to declare the installation null and void. The petition also seeks to prevent any attempt at parallel administration in 1,064 parishes under the Malankara Church

title: Five years to the hour when COVID-19 lockdown hit home
content: Now, the memory of the deaths, economic distress and the mass migration appears like a stranger’s dream for most Indians, many others have not forgotten the horror of a pandemic that killed lakhs of people in the country

title: Will showcase shipbuilding potential in Andhra Pradesh at Singapore Maritime Week, says San Marine Director
content: ‘The SMW-2025 is an annual flagship programme being held in Singapore under the aegis of the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore’

title: Three government schools in Nagapattinam selected under Green School Scheme
content: Launched by the Ministry of Environment and Climate Change, the Green School Scheme seeks to instil awareness about climate change among the younger generation and encourage them to adopt eco-friendly actions

title: Government committed to protecting consumer rights: A.P. Civil Supplies Minister
content: A substantial number of the total 1,33,736 cases filed in consumer forums across the State have been disposed of, says Nadendla Manohar

title: Man sentenced to life for murdering wife in Bapatla district of Andhra Pradesh
content: The Bapatla SP commends the efforts of the investigating officers and court monitoring staff for their role in securing justice in the case

title: "Need To Get Rid Of...": Top Lawyer On Impeachment Amid Judge Cash Row
content: Former Attorney General of India  and senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi has called for a forensic investigation into the cash-at-home scam and said there is a need to streamline the system of disciplinary action against judge

title: Centre Given 4 Weeks To Decide On Rahul Gandhi's Dual Citizenship Case
content: The Lucknow bench of the Allahabad High Court has given Union Home Ministry has been given four weeks to decide on the issue of Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's citizenship.

title: "No Regrets, Will Apologise Only If...": What Kunal Kamra Told Mumbai Cops
content: Comedian Kunal Kamra has told Mumbai Police he does not regret his comment about Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, sources told NDTV Monday afternoon.

title: How 'Messages From The Dead' Sealed Plan To Murder Meerut Man
content: Muskaan Rastogi, the prime accused in her husband Saurabh Rajput's murder, used three Snapchat accounts to convince her boyfriend Sahil Shukla to join the plot, the probe into the chilling case has revealed

title: "Not Dumping Ground": Allahabad Lawyers On Justice Yashwant Varma Return
content: Allahabad High Court lawyers will go on an indefinite strike to protest the Supreme Court Collegium's decision to return to them Justice Yashwant Varma - the Delhi High Court judge from whose home a pile of burnt cash was reportedly found.

title: Chennai Techie Accuses Wife, Cops Of Harassment, She Calls Him 'Sex Predator'
content: The tech entrepreneur alleged that his wife "abducted" their nine-year-old son to the US, forcing him to file an international child abduction case.

title: Salaries, Pensions, Allowances Of MPs Increased. They Will Now Get...
content: The Centre has increased the salaries, allowances and pensions of Members of Parliament with effect from April 1, 2023, according to a gazette notification issued by the Ministry of Parliamentary Affairs on Monday.

title: IPL 2025 LIVE: Pant 'Emotional' vs DC, Rs 34.75 Crore Down The Drain For LSG
content: Delhi Capitals vs Lucknow Super Giants LIVE Score, IPL 2025 LIVE: DC star KL Rahul has been granted special permission to miss their opening game vs LSG.

title: Greenland Furious, Will Boycott US Second Lady's Visit Amid Buyout Threats
content: Displeased would be an understatement to describe the way leaders in Greenland are feeling about the planned visit of the Second Lady of the United States, Usha Vance.

title: Meerut Killers Muskaan, Sahil Made A Mistake That Cost Them Heavily
content: Meerut's Muskaan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla, accused of brutally murdering her husband Saurabh Rajput, had a plan to dispose of the body once they were back from their Himachal vacation

title: Opinion: Delimitation: Don't Let Politics Get In The Way
content: If mishandled, the delimitation exercise could rekindle old regional tensions, much like the linguistic and statehood agitations of the past. India can't afford to get it wrong.

title: 30 Years Before The Diplomat, How An Indian Woman Escaped The Taliban
content: Many years before The Diplomat and Uzma Ahmed's escape from Pakistan to India, an Indian woman escaped the Taliban and came back to India

title: 'Ball-Tampering' In IPL? CSK Duo's Act Caught On Camera, Video Viral
content: A video from the CSK vs MI clash in IPL 2025 has triggered 'ball tampering' speculations on social media.

title: "Haathi, Cheenti Laut Aao": Comic's Post After Kunal Kamra Joke Sparks Row
content: Earlier today, Habitat Studio's management announced that it had decided to shut the premises for now and pointed out that it is not responsible for the views of the artists

title: Tenders floated for construction of integrated vegetable market at Panjapur
content: A sum of ₹236 crore has been sanctioned under the Infrastructure and Amenities Funds (I&A Funds) and ₹100 crore is to be raised through floating municipal bonds

title: Experts and activists urge MoEFCC to investigate ‘environmental pollution’ causing high cancer rates near Grasim Industries’ Chlor-Alkali unit at Bhalabhadrapuram in Andhra Pradesh
content: The factory is reportedly being allowed to use PFOA (Perfluorooctanoic Acid), which causes cancer. Hence, the government environment protection agencies should inspect the factory and initiate measures to prevent further spread of cancer cases at the village, says former IICT scientist

title: Cyber commandos complete training at IIIT, are ready for action
content: Thirty commandos, selected from various State police forces in the country, receive advanced training in cyber defence strategies, ethical hacking, digital forensics, and penetration testing

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: A.P. govt. to give ₹1,10,000 per hectare to rain-hit banana farmers
content: The government will provide an input subsidy of ₹35,000 per hectare to banana farmers, apart from ₹75,000 per hectare for undertaking cultivation again, says Agriculture Minister

title: Tourism clubs formed in college campuses should identify new destinations, says Minister
content: Clubs shall take up responsibility of introducing new destinations on social media to firmly mark them on the State’s tourism map

title: Sethiyathope-Cholapuram section of Vikravandi-Thanjavur NH to be completed by April
content: The 50-km stretch includes three bypasses, four major bridges and 20 VUPs/flyovers besides a new bridge across the Kollidam at Anaikkarai which is being used by the public

title: ‘Zero Poverty – P4’ programme will be launched on Ugadi, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Government is creating a platform under the initiative to enable the wealthy to support the underprivileged, announces the Chief Minister

title: Punganur spruced for Suguturu Ganga Jatara
content: Over 3 lakh people from all over Rayalaseema and neighbouring Karnataka join the fest every year; police to introduce a parent tag system to prevent any incidents of missing children

title: Jagan accuses NDA government of neglecting farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: The former Chief Minister demands immediate compensation for banana farmers who have suffered losses due to the recent rains in Kadapa district

title: Government favouring crony capitalists at expense of small businesses: Mahua Moitra
content: Speaking in the Lok Sabha, Mahua Moitra alleged that the government has created special rules to benefit certain businessmen while neglecting the needs of the broader economy.

title: Two-day Collectors’ conference to be organised from March 25 at the State Secretariat in Andhra Pradesh
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu is expected to give a policy direction to the district officials on industrial growth, economic growth, Swarnandhra 2047, P4 etc, key areas for which the government is according a top priority

title: Ooty residents intensify opposition to Silahalla project
content: In their petition, the residents said the project would submerge hundreds of acres of prime forest areas and private patta and agricultural lands

title: Yoga event held at Meghalaya’s living root bridge
content: The North Eastern Institute of Ayurveda and Homoeopathy organised the event as part of the countdown to the International Day of Yoga 2025

title: Shimla school withdraws pre-Eid celebration directive after threat from right-wing group
content: School authority said they organised the celebration to help young students appreciate India's cultural diversity; Dev Bhoomi Sangarsh Samiti warned to "gherao" the school and take legal action against it if the decision was not withdrawn

title: Rythu Coolie Sangham urges Union government to announce MSP for agriculture products to protect farmers’ interests and livelihood
content: MSP is the need of the hour for farmers in Andhra Pradesh too in the backdrop of steep fall in prices of red chilli, tomatoes and other products in the last few months, says the association’s State secretary Dantuluri Varma

title: Telangana Govt agrees to evolve mechanism to ensure deserving students benefit from Overseas Scholarship Scheme
content: MIM floor leader Akbaruddin Owaisi laments that scheme is being utilised by students from well-to-do families

title: 800 farmers released from detention, 450 more to be freed: Punjab Police
content: The protesting farmers had lashed out at the AAP government for detaining their leaders and removing protesters from the Shambhu and Khanauri border points

title: Supreme Court sets up task force over students' mental health concerns
content: The Bench said the NTF would prepare a comprehensive report that includes, identification of the predominant causes that lead to suicides by students, analysis of existing regulations and recommendations for strengthening protections

title: CBSE examining proposal to allow use of calculator in class 12 accounts exams
content: CBSE considers allowing basic calculators in class 12 exams to reduce cognitive load and improve exam performance.

title: Crocodile spotted on IIT-Bombay Powai Campus road
content: An animal rescuer said crocodiles crawling on the lake road is a rare occurrence given that they generally remain in the lake waters and avoid areas inhabited by humans

title: Supreme Court irked by T.N. Minister Senthilbalaji’s reluctance to respond
content: Expressing shock at the attitude of the Minister, the apex court said he was taking it for a ride and this would not be tolerated.

title: Justice Varma cash recovery row: SC Collegium recommends transfer to Allahabad HC despite Bar’s objection
content: The Delhi High Court Chief Justice D.K. Upadhyaya, too, had been of the prima facie opinion that the judge ought to be shifted out of the Capital in the interest of ‘better administration of justice’

title: ‘Changing Constitution’ statement lands Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar in the eye of a storm
content: DKS maintains that he had not made any statement on changing the Constitution and threatened legal action against those carrying out a misinformation campaign against him

title: Lakhimpur Kheri violence: Supreme Court allows complainant to approach police over new allegations of accused influencing witnesses
content: The complainant submitted that a BJP functionary, who is in close connection with the accused, is trying to influence a very important prosecution witness in the case

title: Door-to-door survey identifies 38 villagers with suspected symptoms of different types of cancer in Bhalabadrapuram
content: 23 patients are undergoing medical treatment for cancer; doctors from the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital & Research Centre, Visakhapatnam, Rajamahendravaram GGH, Kakinada Rangarayana Medical College and G.S.L. Hospital are studying the high incidence of cancer in Bhalabadrapuram village

title: Plea seeks police probe into allegations of cash found in Delhi HC judge’s residential premises
content: The petition by advocate-petitioner Nedumpara questions the jurisdiction of the three-member committee to inquire into the allegations; seeks return of the Judicial Standards and Accountability Bill, 2010

title: Maharashtra assembly passes resolution recommending Bharat Ratna for Jyotirao Phule, Savitribai
content: Expressing happiness at the assembly passing the resolution, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar said bestowing the country's highest civilian award to the iconic social reformers will be honouring public sentiment

title: Centre notifies 24% hike in salaries, pensions for MPs
content: Now a current Member of Parliament will get a salary of ₹1.24 lakh per month while former Member of Parliament will receive a pension of ₹31,000 per month.

title: Interim report on vexed internal reservation issue in Karnataka to be submitted by H.N. Nagmohan Das Commission next week
content: As a precursor, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah chaired a meeting of cabinet ministers hailing from the scheduled caste communities on March 24 in which the retired judge also took part

title: SC agrees to list on March 25 a plea to direct CBI probe Karnataka ‘honey-trapping’ allegations
content: The honey-trap allegations were made by the Minister on the floor of the State Legislative Assembly, triggering a political storm in the State.

title: When the Mysore Maharaja permitted a British engineer to shoot a leopard near Chamundi Hills in 1908
content: The engineer’s grandson has a copy of the letter issued by the Assistant Private Secretary to the Maharaja of Mysore on June 27, 1908

title: Villupuram MP urges Centre to publish findings on Keezhadi excavations
content: Raising the issue under Rule 377 in the Lok Sabha, D. Ravikumar said an archaeologist from the ASI had already submitted reports on the first two phases of the excavation to the Union government

title: Andhra Pradesh announces Innovation, Startup Policy (4.0) 2024 -2029
content: The policy aims at creating 20,000 new startups in the next five years and at least one lakh employment

title: Jairam Ramesh gives notice of privilege in Rajya Sabha against Kiren Rijiju for ‘misleading’ House
content: Mr. Ramesh gave the notice under Rule 188 of the Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business in the Council of States (Rajya Sabha).

title: Delegation of T.N. MPs to meet PM Modi seeking fair delimitation: CM Stalin
content: Speaking on the floor of the Legislative Assembly about the meeting of the Joint Action Committee on Fair Delimitation held recently in Chennai, he said the lead taken by Tamil Nadu on the issue of delimitation has had a national impact

title: Over 90 lakh updated tax returns filed, ₹9,118 crore additional taxes mobilised
content: Through Finance Bill, 2025, the government has proposed to extend the time limit for filing updated returns to up to 4 years from the relevant assessment year

title: In a first, Darjeeling zoo launches project to preserve DNA samples of wildlife in Hills
content: Chief Wildlife Warden Debal Roy said 60 DNA samples from indigenous animals have already been collected for profiling

title: Head priest of Chilkur temple advocates use of temple funds for only spiritual purposes
content: The temple priest emphasised the need to allocate these resources for ensuring ‘dhoopa deepa and naivedhyam’ in the temples with limited income

title: Government extends support to banana farmers who attempted to end life following crop loss
content: The Chief Minister directed the Anantapur district administration to monitor the health condition of the two farmers undergoing treatment at the Government General Hospital

title: Rajeev Chandrasekhar takes charge as president of BJP’s Kerala unit
content: BJP’s central observer Pralhad Joshi says Rajeev Chandrasekhar has been unanimously elected to the post

title: Aircraft carrying Himachal Deputy CM Mukesh Agnihotri faces glitch, misses landing at Shimla's Jubbarhatti Airport
content: All passengers stayed on the plane for about 20-25 minutes and the Dharamshala flight was cancelled, says Himachal Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Mukesh Agnihotri

title: Devendra Fadnavis on Kunal Kamra row: Recklessness in garb of freedom of speech won't be tolerated
content: The Opposition is supporting such a talk and one wonders whether Mr. Kamra is hand-in-glove with the Opposition, CM Fadnavis said

title: RG Kar rape and murder case: Calcutta High Court asks for case diary, poses questions to CBI
content: Calcutta High Court directs CBI to produce case diary in rape-murder case, considering gang rape and evidence destruction possibilities.

title: Kerala Assembly: Opposition walks out over public health crisis, slams government’s ‘complacency’
content: V.D. Satheesan criticises government for ‘resting on its laurels’ and claiming that State was ‘number one’ in health while Kerala’s public health is going through a crisis like never before

title: Over a month of Telangana tunnel collapse; Govt to continue rescue op
content: Telangana CM directs appointment of a senior IAS officer to oversee the continuous rescue and search operation

title: Chakma language is not Bengali, community tells panel for linguistic minorities
content: Annual reports submitted by the Commissioner for Linguistic Minorities continue to misidentify the Chakma language despite a note for rectification two decades ago

title: BJP came up with 'completely fake' issue to get Parliament adjourned: Congress
content: Rajya Sabha proceedings were adjourned on Monday in the pre-lunch session without transacting any business as treasury and opposition benches sparred over the issue of reservations to Muslims in Karnataka public contracts

title: London exhibit spotlights Victor Hugo's lesser-known talent, drawing
content: Discover Victor Hugo’s lesser-known talent as an illustrator in London’s new exhibition showcasing his poetic ink and wash drawings

title: LWE-affected residents want development, says President Murmu in Chhattisgarh
content: The task of connecting people affected by left wing extremism to the mainstream of society has reached its final and decisive stage, said President Murmu

title: U.P. transformed from struggling State to an economic powerhouse in 8 years: CM
content: Mr. Adityanath credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi's policies of service, security and good governance for the progress

title: Delhi electricity rates to rise due to ₹27,000 crore debt under AAP government: Ashish Sood
content: Responding to a question by AAP MLA Imran Hussain in the Delhi Assembly on the expected increase in electricity tariffs, Delhi Minister Ashish Sood said that Discoms are authorised to hike rates to recover outstanding amount

title: Sources: Iowa to hire Drake's McCollum as coach
content: Iowa has agreed to hire Drake's Ben McCollum as its next men's basketball coach, sources told ESPN on Monday.

title: Ole Miss cruises, becomes 7th SEC Sweet 16 team
content: Proud of the way his team battled through a rugged SEC schedule this season, Ole Miss guard Matthew Murrell, after the Rebels secured a berth in the Sweet 16 on Sunday by defeating Iowa State, said his league was "one of the best conferences of all time."

title: Queen's buzzer shot sends Terrapins to Sweet 16
content: Derik Queen banked in a fadeaway jumper at the buzzer to lift Maryland over Colorado State 72-71 and into the Sweet 16.

title: 'Generational' Betts powers UCLA with 30-14 night
content: Lauren Betts, in leading the Bruins to the Sweet 16 on Sunday, became the first UCLA player to score 30 points and grab at least 10 rebounds in an NCAA tournament game. "She's an absolute generational player," coach Cori Close said.

title: Poch: U.S. has 'time' to fix issues before World Cup
content: After suffering two defeats in the Concacaf Nations League, United States manager Mauricio Pochettino insisted that his side still has enough time to turn things around before the 2026 World Cup.

title: Tiger confirms dating Trump's ex-daughter-in-law
content: "Love is in the air," said Tiger Woods, as he went public to confirm he's dating President Trump's former daughter-in-law Vanessa Trump, 47.

title: Hurley: UConn's historic run ends with 'honor'
content: UConn coach Dan Hurley said there was "some honor" in the end to UConn's 13-game tournament win streak, which was halted in a narrow loss to Florida on Sunday.

title: Sources: Texas nearing deal with Xavier's Miller
content: Less than a week after appearing in the First Four of the NCAA tournament, where it lost to Xavier, Texas on Sunday informed coach Rodney Terry that he has been fired, with athletic director Chris Del Conte later saying the decision was "very difficult."

title: Women's March Madness Day 3 guide: Analysis and recaps as half of Sweet 16 set
content: Half the Sweet 16 is set. No. 5 seeds Tennessee, Ole Miss and Kansas State and a pair of 1-seeds won on Day 3.

title: The moves that rocked the MLB offseason - and what they mean for the 2025 season
content: Juan Soto got how much!? The Dodgers added how many stars? It's time to get up to speed after a wild winter.

title: Loss to Canada closes out miserable window for Pochettino's USMNT
content: The USMNT defense looked helpless in Sunday's Concacaf Nations League defeat to Canada. And has Christian Pulisic run out of gas?

title: Why the NBA could be headed for 'worst tanking stretch we've ever seen'
content: Teams are getting really good at tanking. Can the NBA do anything more to stop it? Here's what's next for the race to the bottom.

title: NHL playoff watch: Can the Canucks get back on track?
content: Vancouver needs every point it can get, including tonight against New Jersey. Plus, full playoff projections.

title: Yamal hits back at Van der Vaart after Spain win
content: Lamine Yamal has quipped back at Rafael van der Vaart's "pants down" jibe after helping Spain beat Netherlands in Sunday's UEFA Nations League quarterfinal.

title: Mexico wins 1st Nations League on late penalty
content: Raúl Jiménez scored his second goal on a penalty kick in second-half stoppage time as Mexico beat Panama 2-1 Sunday night at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, to win the Concacaf Nations League tournament for the first time.

title: Ball boy hailed as hero as Germany oust Italy
content: Germany's 5-4 aggregate win over Italy on Sunday earned them a spot in the Nations League last four and also created an unlikely new hero: a rookie ball boy.

title: Marsch sent off during Canada win over USMNT
content: Canada coach Jesse Marsch was shown a direct red card during early in the second half of his team's 2-1 Concacaf Nations League third-place match win over the United States on Sunday.

title: You da' Maignan: 'Difference' in goal, Mbappé says
content: France produced a great attacking performance to overturn a two-goal deficit against Croatia and level their Nations League tie on Sunday, but it was keeper Mike Maignan who stole the spotlight with his penalty heroics in a 5-4 shootout victory.

title: Newcastle Women draw record 38,502 crowd
content: Newcastle United's women's side smashed the Women's Championship attendance record on Sunday, drawing 38,502 fans for their clash against Sunderland.

title: MLS: Charlotte sneaking up on league's best
content: Vancouver isn't the only surprise contender in 2025 as Charlotte is turning heads in our MLS Power Rankings.

title: Aaliyah Chavez's unlikely route to top girls basketball prospect
content: As a college decision looms, the sought-after point guard reflects on a late start but quick rise in the game.

title: Inside the incredibly high-risk, low-reward LeBron James bet
content: LeBron James' streak of scoring 10 points in a game continues, but with significant money on the line each game, two people are paying attention to this trend more than most.

title: Ferrari's Shanghai debacle: Explaining Hamilton, Leclerc DQs
content: Why were both Ferraris disqualified in China, and how costly could that be in F1's constructors' title fight?

title: Kyle Larson takes Homestead, gets 30th career win
content: Kyle Larson passed Alex Bowman with six laps remaining in NASCAR's Cup Series race at Homestead-Miami Speedway on Sunday, giving the Hendrick Motorsports driver the 30th win of his career at one of his best tracks.

title: Why George Foreman will be remembered as 'That Guy'
content: George Foreman was a champion, but for a lot of nonboxing fans, he will be remembered for so much more.

title: Stunning scissor kick wins People's Puskas award for best amateur goal
content: The goal voted as the world's best of the year scored in an amateur match shows the enduring appeal of seeing a beautiful bicycle kick, at any level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid must choose Vinicius or Rodrygo
content: Will Vinícius Júnior or Rodrygo have to leave Real Madrid this summer? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Impeach Justice Varma ... will not tolerate transfer': Allahabad HC Bar chief on cash row
content: The Allahabad High Court Bar Association has condemned the transfer of Justice Yashwant Varma from Delhi High Court following a cash recovery from his residence. The association demanded a CBI and ED investigation and called for impeachment proceedings, questioning the fairness of the judicial appointment system.

title: 'Don't panic but ...': Immigration lawyers to Indians with Green Cards
content: With heightened scrutiny from the US government, Indian green card holders are concerned about their status. Experts advise that as long as they adhere to US laws, maintain strong ties, and avoid long stays abroad, they have little to fear. Important documentation and lawful compliance are crucial.

title: Nagpur riot: Bombay HC halts demolition of homes linked to accused
content: The Bombay High Court's Nagpur bench has temporarily halted the demolition of homes linked to those accused in recent riots, citing the need for legal review. The court questioned the Nagpur Municipal Corporation's action following arguments about arbitrary demolitions and violation of Supreme Court guidelines.

title: Why KL Rahul is not playing Delhi Capitals' opening match
content: KL Rahul was absent from Delhi Capitals' playing XI in their IPL 2025 opener against Lucknow Super Giants due to personal reasons. The Indian cricketer is expecting his first child and is expected to rejoin the squad for their next game on March 30. Although Axar did not mention KL Rahul’s absence, reports suggest that Rahul missed the game due to personal reasons.

title: Amazon CEO to employees: We are changing how we do promotions
content: Amazon's CEO Andy Jassy has announced a shift in the company's promotion strategy, focusing on smaller, efficient teams rather than larger fiefdoms. Highlighting the impact of smaller teams in past successes, Jassy emphasized meritocracy and getting things done for customers over bureaucracy. He urged employees to work fast, think like owners, and adapt to intense competition.

title: Columbia folds, academia buckles: How Trump is reshaping US higher education
content: Columbia University's concessions to comply with President Trump's administration, including banning face masks during protests and giving arrest powers to campus security, have raised concerns in academia. These measures aim to reclaim educational institutions from left-wing ideology, affecting federal funding, research projects, and academic freedom, as other universities brace for similar pressures.

title: 'Batting first, batting first': Pant teases Axar as DC opt to bowl vs LSG - Watch
content: Axar Patel and Rishabh Pant, now captaining opposing IPL teams, shared a friendly moment during the coin toss. Axar, Delhi Capitals skipper, won the toss and chose to bowl first. Pant, leading Lucknow Super Giants, showed a positive attitude. Their camaraderie highlighted their mutual respect, despite the new rivalry as team captains.

title: From Arnab to VHP: 5 times Kunal Kamra courted controversy
content: Comedian Kunal Kamra has faced violent backlash and legal trouble after calling Maharashtra's deputy CM Eknath Shinde a 'gaddar'. This incident adds to Kamra's history of controversies, including clashes with journalist Arnab Goswami, mocking Kangana Ranaut, a contempt of court case, and a conflict with OLA Electric.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk: 'No more loans to...' as DOGE fights loan fraud
content: Elon Musk supports the new SBA policy to prevent fraud involving stolen Social Security numbers, requiring applicants’ date of birth for direct loans. Measures include halting loans for those under 18 or over 120 years old, addressing past fraudulent cases and improving data integrity in federal loan programs.

title: 'Lied to Parliament': Kharge on BJP's 'Cong to change Constitution' claim
content: Congress leader Malliakarjun Kharge intends to pursue legal action against BJP's JP Nadda and Kiren Rijiju for allegedly making false claims that Congress is providing reservations based on religion in Karnataka. This follows a heated debate in Parliament over the issue, with Kharge asserting that the BJP is raising the issue to distract from its corruption.

title: India to conduct joint naval exercise 'Aikeyme' with 10 African nations
content: India will conduct its first major naval exercise named `Aikeyme` with 10 African nations and launch `Indian Ocean ship (IOS) Sagar` initiative next month. These efforts aim to enhance maritime security in the Indian Ocean Region (IOR) and solidify India’s role as a preferred security partner. Aikeyme exercise will involve various countries focusing on marine drills and rescue operations.

title: Rippling co-founder Prasanna Sankar on run, claims divorce harassment on Twitter
content: Prasanna Sankar, co-founder of Rippling, has accused his wife of infidelity and filing false legal claims against him, leading him to flee with his son from the Chennai police.

title: 'Calling gaddar a gaddar': Shiv Sena (UBT) backs Kamra, target Shinde
content: Uddhav Thackeray expressed support for Kunal Kamra regarding his 'gaddar' comment towards Eknath Shinde. Thackeray clarified that calling a 'gaddar' is not an attack. He disassociated Shiv Sena from recent vandalism acts, attributing them to the 'gaddar sena.' Meanwhile, a BMC inspection identified unauthorized structures at Kamra's show venue for removal.

title: Why Usha Vance is an 'unwelcome visitor' in Greenland
content: The timing of the visit has only heightened tensions. Greenland held parliamentary elections earlier this month, resulting in a loss of majority for Egede’s Inuit Ataqatigiit party. Though he remains the caretaker prime minister, coalition talks are ongoing. Jens-Frederik Nielsen, whose party is expected to lead the next government, also criticized the visit.

title: Sensex surges over 1,000 points: Top reasons for D-Street rally
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Monday. While the BSE Sensex went above 78,100 level, Nifty50 crossed 23,700 intraday.

title: Dwayne Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shares how his decision helped family
content: Dwayne Wade, the NBA legend, shared his journey about his December 2023 cancer diagnosis and successful surgery, where a cyst was removed from his kidney. His wife, Gabrielle Union, provided an update, expressing their relief and peace as he is now cancer free. Wade's openness about his experience aims to inspire and support others facing similar challenges.

title: 'Uddhav funded Kamra's show': Sena's big claim on comic's 'gaddar' remark
content: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Nirupam accused Kunal Kamra of making a derogatory comment about Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde, claiming the show was funded by the Uddhav Thackeray faction. Nirupam warned Kamra and stated that legal action would follow if he does not apologize. Kamra's parody referred to Shinde as a 'traitor', prompting backlash from Shiv Sena workers.

title: Sona Mohapatra slams Salman Khan over 31-year age gap remark
content: Singer Sona Mohapatra has criticized actor Salman Khan for his response to discussions about the significant 31-year age gap between him and his Sikandar co-star Rashmika Mandanna. She called him the "bhai of toxic masculinity." On Monday, Sona took to X (formerly Twitter) to call out Salman’s statement justifying the age difference. Salman had earlier remarked that if Rashmika and her father had no issue, others should not be concerned.

title: Centre notifies increase in salary, pension for MPs
content: The central government has increased the salaries, allowances, and pensions of MPs and former MPs by 24% effective April 1, 2023. MPs will now earn Rs 1.24 lakh per month, with daily allowances and pensions for former MPs also being raised. This marks the first revision since 2018, aligning with the Cost Inflation Index.

title: Bhabhiji Ghar Par Hain writer Manoj Santoshi passes away
content: Manoj Santoshi, a well-known television writer for the hit comedy show Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain, passed away on March 23, 2025, due to a liver-related illness. His death marks a significant loss for the Indian television industry where he made considerable contributions.

title: Watch: BMC officials arrive at Habitat studio with hammers amid Kamra row
content: BMC officials inspected Unicontinental Mall in Mumbai and found an unauthorized temporary shed, after Shiv Sena workers vandalized Habitat Studio over comedian Kunal Kamra's joke about Eknath Shinde. Habitat Studio temporarily shut down in response. An FIR was registered against key participants in the vandalism.

title: 'Step in right direction': VP hails SC move on cash recovery row
content: Rajya Sabha chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar lauds Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna for unprecedented transparency in handling the controversy over cash found at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence. The Delhi high court withdraws Justice Varma's judicial duties amid ongoing investigations.

title: 'Ishan Kishan celebrations were aimed at selectors and Rohit'
content: Ishan Kishan smashed an unbeaten 106 off 47 balls, propelling Sunrisers Hyderabad to a 44-run victory over Rajasthan Royals. Dropped from the BCCI’s central contracts last year, Kishan’s explosive performance and celebration signaled his return to form and sent a strong message to Indian selectors and captain Rohit Sharma. After a dominant win against Rajasthan Royals, Sunrisers Hyderabad will next face Lucknow Super Giants on Thursday at the same venue.

title: Steyn predicts when, against whom will the first 300 runs be scored
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad set a formidable 286/6 in their IPL 2025 opener, led by Ishan Kishan's explosive century on debut. Former South African pacer Dale Steyn predicted IPL's first 300-run total could be seen this season, highlighting the prospect of high-scoring matches ahead. Impressed by their explosive start to the season, Steyn—who represented Sunrisers Hyderabad from 2013 to 2015—took to social media with a bold prediction:

title: Watch: Asia’s only marathon on snow held at Lahaul Spiti
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: RG Kar case: Calcutta HC tells CBI to probe gangrape angle
content: The Calcutta high court directed the CBI to present the case diary of the rape and murder of a doctor at RG Kar Hospital, considering the possibility of gang rape or evidence destruction. The victim's parents sought further investigation into a larger conspiracy. The court awaits the CBI’s status report and clarifications on multiple suspects.

title: SC refuses to hear plea against Allahabad HC 'not rape' ruling
content: Supreme Court dismissed a plea challenging the Allahabad High Court’s ruling, which stated that grabbing a minor girl’s breasts and breaking her pyjama did not amount to rape or an attempt to rape. The court categorized the act under aggravated sexual assault. The high court believed the actions did not demonstrate a clear intent to commit rape.

title: Saurabh Rajput murder: Cop under lens for failing to seal Sahil Shukla’s room
content: A senior police officer in Meerut is being investigated for failing to seal the room of Sahil Shukla, co-accused in Saurabh Rajput's murder case. This oversight has raised concerns of evidence tampering. Both accused are in judicial custody, facing severe drug withdrawal symptoms.

title: 'Can't speak whatever he wants': Maha govt vs oppn over Kamra row
content: Kunal Kamra's comedy special 'Naya Bharat' sparked a political dispute when Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis demanded an apology from Kamra. The comedy piece featured a joke about deputy CM Eknath Shinde, leading to protests and vandalism by Shiv Sena workers at the venue. Opposition leaders criticized the government's reaction.

title: Justice for Johnny & Matthew Gaudreau: A closer look at trial of Sean Higgins
content: The tragic deaths of Johnny and Matthew Gaudreau in a drunk driving accident led to legal action against Sean Higgins. Higgins faced multiple charges and rejected a plea deal, opting for trial, highlighting the severe consequences of impaired driving.

title: Watch: Vignesh Puthur touches Nita Ambani's feet after dazzling IPL debut
content: Young spinner Vignesh Puthur touched Nita Ambani's feet after receiving the 'Best Bowler' award from Mumbai Indians. He impressed on his IPL debut by taking three key wickets against Chennai Super Kings. Despite MI's defeat, Vignesh's humble gesture and performance won admiration. He thanked the MI team and captain for their support.

title: Who is Fahim Khan? Arrested minority leader at heart of Nagpur violence
content: Fahim Khan, leader of the Minorities Democratic Party, is a key figure in the Nagpur riots investigation. He was arrested by Ganeshpeth police for allegedly inciting the Mahal riots. His political career is under scrutiny. The riots resulted in significant destruction, including 70 injuries and over 40 vehicles torched. Police have booked over 1,200 individuals.

title: When and where to watch DC vs LSG match live online
content: The IPL 2025 showdown between Delhi Capitals and Lucknow Super Giants features exciting cricket action with new captains and revamped squads. Delhi, led by Axar Patel with KL Rahul, will face off against Rishabh Pant's Lucknow side. Fans can catch the live match on JioCinema, Hotstar, Star Sports, and Sports 18.

title: Kamra comedy row: Shiv Sena member, 11 others arrested for vandalising venue
content: Shiv Sena functionary Rahool Kanal was arrested for vandalizing the venue after comedian Kunal Kamra labeled deputy chief minister Eknath Shinde a 'traitor' during a performance. Authorities filed an FIR against several Shiv Sena members while Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis condemned Kamra’s remarks, demanding an apology.

title: Humanity in war: When an Indian Major let a newlywed Pak soldier escape in 1971
content: The first edition of Shaurya Saga, a Defence Literature Festival organised by NGO Thrive, concluded at Doon University. Eminent figures shared compelling stories, including that of an Indian Major's act of compassion during the 1971 Indo-Pak war, highlighting humanity even amidst conflict.

title: Raped by dad, deserted by mother, Nepali teenager fought battle all alone
content: A Nepali teenager faced a lone battle for justice after accusing her father of raping her in 2023. Despite her mother's initial support, she later turned hostile during the trial. However, the court sentenced the father to life imprisonment and awarded the girl 2 lakh compensation.

title: 'Electricity rates in Delhi to rise due to Rs 27k cr debt under AAP,' claims BJP
content: Delhi Power Minister Ashish Sood indicated that electricity prices might rise due to a Rs 27,000 crore debt left by the previous AAP government with power distribution companies. Sood revealed that Discoms could raise rates to recover the dues, as directed by the Delhi High Court.

title: 'Koi nahi rok sakta': Lalu asserts Tejashwi will form govt; JD(U) reacts
content: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav declared that his son Tejashwi would form the government in Bihar, pledging to implement women's welfare schemes. Opposition leaders criticized the statement, with JD(U) and BJP dismissing it as unrealistic and referencing Lalu's tarnished political legacy. Deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha asserted Lalu himself was the biggest obstacle to Tejashwi's political success.

title: Rs 3.4 L cr hit to market cap! Adani stocks plunge up to 48% so far in FY25
content: Adani Group stocks' market capitalisation has dropped by 21% in FY25. Regulatory scrutiny and allegations of bribery further impacted the group's stock values, while external economic factors and foreign investors exacerbated the situation.

title: Cash recovery row: Delhi HC withdraws judicial work from Justice Yashwant Varma
content: Justice Yashwant Varma's Monday cases have been removed from the hearing list following an in-house investigation after substantial cash was discovered at his residence during a fire. A three-judge panel has been appointed to inquire into the allegations against him, with no specified timeframe for completion.

title: CBSE introduces key reforms: Basic calculators allowed in Class 12 accountancy
content: CBSE has introduced key reforms for the 2025-26 session, allowing basic calculators in Class 12 accountancy exams and launching digital evaluation. The move aims to ease cognitive load and align with global standards. Additionally, the board will implement On-Screen Marking (OSM) and a new re-evaluation system, along with curriculum revisions to enhance vocational education and assessment practices.
